channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Meghan Markle is ready to take the stand against her father, says her lawyer
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, is suing Associated Newspapers, owner of the Mail on Sunday and MailOnline, over an article which reproduced parts of a handwritten letter she sent to Mr Markle, 75.

item.title: DAVID DAVIS: If Australia lets families see each other in the coronavirus lockdown, why can't we?
item.description: DAVID DAVIS: When challenged on the decisions that they have taken in the past few months, ministers invariably answer: 'All our decisions are based on the science'.

item.title: Chris Whitty reveals the UK's 'reproduction number' dropped below 1
item.description: England's chief medical officer has offered a chink of light out of the lockdown after revealing coronavirus infection rates in the UK have been wrestled down.

item.title: Priti Patel will warn 'selfish rule-breakers' to stop flouting coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The Home Secretary will underscore her warning to stay indoors with the threat of beefing up the police's powers to enforce social distancing.

item.title: Watchdog presenter Lynn Faulds Wood dies at 72 after 'stroke'
item.description: Lynn Faulds Wood passed away at midday with her husband John Stapleton and son, Nick, by her bedside after suffering a 'massive stroke' last night, confirmed the former Watchdog host's family.

item.title: Chancellor draws up plans to reopen non-essential businesses with social distancing within weeks
item.description: McDonalds, British Steel, and construction firm Persimmon were among the first high-profile companies to announce their intention to reopen in May.

item.title: Captain Tom Moore breaks the world record for the oldest person to have a No.1 single
item.description: Captain Tom Moore has become the oldest person to have a No.1 single after his song with Michael Ball reached the top of the UK charts.

item.title: Cabinet ministers were warned last year about a coronavirus pandemic
item.description: The National Security Risk Assessment highlighted the devastating social and economic costs of a major disease outbreak and was signed off by chief scientific adviser Sir Patrick Vallance.

item.title: Kanye West officially becomes a billionaire according to Forbes report
item.description: Kanye West has officially joined the billionaires club.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 46,000 key workers try to book a test as checks run out in minutes
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps tonight revealed 46,000 people tried to book a coronavirus test on the government's new website this morning as checks ran out in minutes.

item.title: We reveal the deadly risks that could cost the ultimate price
item.description: Thousands of researchers in governments, labs and drug firms are working flat-out to crack the cure to covid-19. As are endless armchair experts, whose numbers now evidently include Donald Trump.

item.title: PICTURED: Man who died ingesting fish tank cleaner thinking it was malaria drug championed by Trump
item.description: Gary Lenius and his wife Wanda, both in their 60s, took chloroquine phosphate. The couple, from Arizona, had confused the cleaner with hydroxychloroquine.

item.title: Armed police raid home of Jacob Rees-Mogg's staff looking for firearms
item.description: Armed officers used a battering ram to smash through the front door of the family home of Donna Coles, 49, and husband Andy, 57. They live less than a mile from Rees-Mogg's country estate.

item.title: Cheltenham landlord dies from coronavirus amid calls for probe into why the festival went ahead
item.description: 67-year-old landlord Alexander Grierson died after contracting coronavirus during the Cheltenham festival. Calls are being made to investigate why the races went ahead.

item.title: The Queen's life in lockdown: Her Majesty has been cloistered in her private apartments at Windsor
item.description: Queen Elizabeth, 94, has been isolating with Prince Phillip, 98, since March 19 - despite her husband usually preferring to spend his time at Wood Farm on their Sandringham estate in Norfolk.

item.title: Boris Johnson's sister urges him to reveal plans for how the UK will leave coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Rachel Johnson made the comments on her new Friday evening show on LBC.

item.title: Thought your kids were a handful? Spare a thought for this isolated shepherdess
item.description: For while the rest of the UK has been in coronavirus lockdown, life - and death - have continued on Gray's remote 150-acre farm, near Morpeth, Northumberland.

item.title: Top EU negotiator Michel Barnier rages at deadlock as UK trade talks resume
item.description: Britain locked horns with the EU over fishing rights yesterday after the first post-Brexit trade talks in more than a month.

item.title: Brits face getaway misery with attractions shut and a ban on foreign travel
item.description: Britain faces summer holiday misery with attractions shut, a ban on foreign travel and a £45billion black hole in tourism spending.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: Oh Harry... how Diana would have despaired
item.description: RICHARD KAY: So much about Harry is reminiscent of Diana. The palpable way he connects with people is uncannily like that of his mother.

item.title: Government considers relaxing strict 'stay at home' rules to allow small groups to meet
item.description: In an idea reminiscent of BT's 'Friends and Families' scheme, people would nominate a small list of those they want to be able to see, drawn from no more than one or two households.

item.title: A minute-by-minute account of VE Day
item.description: News of the German surrender spread around Britain during the afternoon and immediately bunting and flags appeared in the streets.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'will return to work on Monday' as a part-time PM
item.description: The Prime Minister has spent a fortnight at his country retreat, Chequers, after being hospitalised with coronavirus.

item.title: Tom Tugendhat accuses 'tyrannical' China of 'falsifying' coronavirus death statistics
item.description: Tom Tugendhat today accused the Chinese government of 'tyranny' and of 'falsifying' its coronavirus death toll statistics in comments which prompted a furious response from Beijing.

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: How Wills turned into a right royal Goon on the Big Night In - and we loved it!
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: The most reliable, and dare I say wooden, member of the younger royals stole the show with a comic turn on the BBC's fundraiser The Big Night In.

item.title: 40 million year old frog remains discovered in Antarctica, suggesting it once had warmer climate
item.description: Researchers in Antartica have discovered the remains of a frog that dates back 40 million years, to a period when the frozen continent was covered in temperate rainforests.
item.media:credit: Jonas Hagström / The Swedish Museum of Natural History

item.title: Donald Trump WALKS OUT of coronavirus briefing after his disinfectant disaster
item.description: President Donald Trump avoided questions at his White House briefing Friday after giving conflicting responses on his proposed idea of treating coronavirus with disinfectants.

item.title: Coronavirus: How different countries value a life for calculations
item.description: One year's life is valued at around £20,000 to £30,000, according to guidelines from the UK's National Institute for Care and Health Excellence (NICE), which is assessing treatments for Covid-19.

item.title: UK launches trial into coronavirus blood plasma treatment that could help 5,000 patients a week
item.description: The Governemnt has authorised a new trial into a coronavirus blood plasma treatment. Health Secretary Matt Hancock says it could help 5,000 patients every week if the trial is a success.

item.title: Chinese medical team dispatched to North Korea to advise on Kim Jong-un's care
item.description: The trip by the Chinese doctors and officials comes amid conflicting reports about the health of the North Korean leader.

item.title: Old age 'officially' starts at 61... and just thinking about it makes Brits stressed, survey finds
item.description: The survey of 2,000 Britons pinpointed the point at which we think we're 'past it' at 61. It also found that three-quarters of us worry about ageing, and half say it makes us feel stressed.

item.title: Princess Eugenie and husband Jack Brooksbank celebrate their 10th anniversary with Instagram snap
item.description: Princess Eugenie took to Instagram to celebrate her anniversary with husband Jack Brookshank by posting a loved-up picture. In the post the tenth-in-line said her and her husband were lucky to be together.

item.title: Ex-Army captain and actor who both transitioned reveal story of how they became transgender parents
item.description: Every birth is a minor miracle, but for Jake and Hannah Graf the safe arrival of their baby daughter last Tuesday was cause for particular jubilation and relief.

item.title: Parts of India see death rates FALL amid coronavirus outbreak, bucking the global trend
item.description: Parts of India have recorded dramatic falls in the number of deaths at a time when funeral parlours were bracing for a surge amid the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: DR ALEX GEORGE: From Love Island to hell in my hospital
item.description: Across the country, every day thousands of NHS workers are putting their lives on the line to care for our most vulnerable. Here Love Island's DR ALEX GEORGE, an A&E doctor shares his front-line diary...

item.title: Syd Little is among mourners at Eddie Large's funeral after star died from coronavirus
item.description: Around 50 well-wishers turned out to show their support for the comedian as his body was taken to a crematorium in Portishead, Somerset this afternoon.

item.title: NHS to release plan next week to 'redeploy coronavirus capacity'
item.description: NHS bosses are keen to get operating theatres back up and running and to return to business as usual for non-coronavirus patients who may have been missing out on treatment for weeks.

item.title: Lady Carnarvon - chatelaine of the 'real Downton Abbey' talks about cleaning her house
item.description: One of the legacies of lockdown could be that we all end up with spotless homes. With time on our hands, we are turning into a nation of housekeepers, fearlessly delving into dusty corners.

item.title: Industry stars in chorus of outrage over Tom Watson's new role as UK Music boss
item.description: The former deputy Labour leader's competence for the job has been questioned by many in the music indusry, given his history of promoting fake allegations of a VIP paedophile ring

item.title: Vogue editor Anna 'Nuclear' Wintour has fallen out with her right-hand man Andre Leon Talley...
item.description: There was a time when Andre Leon Talley's friendship with Dame Anna Wintour was regarded as a match made in fashion heaven.

item.title: Coronavirus has made cancelling holidays a nightmare - here's the lowdown on refunds and vouchers
item.description: This week we've been inundated by requests for help with coronavirus-related travel problems. We can't address them all, but we hope these answers will help.

item.title: Prime Minister Boris Johnson 'briefed on plans to have Premier League football return within weeks'
item.description: The Prime Minister has been informed of the proposals for matches to be played behind closed doors. And Mr Johnson sees the resumption of live sport as key to boosting the moral of the nation.

item.title: Predator jailed for 16 years for raping mother-of-two as her children listened
item.description: John Ward, 24, was jailed for 16 years after following and raping a mother-of-two at her Rochdale home while her children listened. His accomplice Aaron Farrell, 24, was jailed for 21 months.

item.title: Plasma therapy DOES work: Doctors say the treatment saved life of a coronavirus patient near death
item.description: Doctors at UMass Memorial Medical Center in Worcester received their first shipment this weekend and gave it to a male patient who was near death, who improved within a few hours.

item.title: Mecca deserted during Ramadan as Muslims are forced to celebrate in isolation because of coronavirus
item.description: The central courtyard of the Great Mosque of Mecca has been deserted as Muslims are forced to celebrate Ramadan in isolation, leaving the holy site practically empty.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Identical twin nurses, 37, die days apart
item.description: Emma Davis, a former nurse herself, died at Southampton General Hospital today, just three days after the death of identical twin Katy, a children's nurse, at the same hospital.

item.title: Elon Musk reveals SpaceX will launch its Starlink internet service in just 6 MONTHS
item.description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk shared on Twitter that Starlink internet will roll out in private beta in three months, will public beta starting in just six months to certain parts of the world.

item.title: Karl Lagerfeld's mother 'strapped him to his bed to stop him from eating', André Leon Talley reveals
item.description: André Leon Talley explains it was one of the reasons he and Karl Lagerfeld became friends for decades - they had both suffered 'abuse' in their childhoods, he writes in his new memoir.

item.title: Kim Jong-un sees himself as the North Korean John F. Kennedy, book claims
item.description: A new book claims that the leader of North Korea sees himself as John F. Kennedy and his wife Ri Sol Ju as the parallel of Jackie Kennedy.

item.title: Captain Tom Moore, 99, 'is added to honours shortlist as nominations flood in'
item.description: Captain Tom could now receive a CBE after his fundraising efforts for the National Health Service amid the coronavirus pandemic captured the hearts of the nation.

item.title: Father writes heartbreaking letter to wife and kids before dying of coronavirus
item.description: Jon Coelho, 32, died from a cardiac arrest caused by coronavirus in hospital in Connecticut on Wednesday after writing a heartbreaking final letter to his wife and two young children.

item.title: Amazon is making £9,000 a second during coronavirus crisis... but it has closed a fraud helpline
item.description: The retailer has enjoyed a surge in sales from customers forced to stay at home, but many say they have been defrauded on the site - and claim they cannot get any help.

item.title: Gunman opens fire as hundreds of mourners pay respects to Manchester godfather 'Mr Ibiza'
item.description: A gunman opened fire at mourners broke social distancing rules to attend the funeral of a father dubbed 'Mr Ibiza' in a Manchester cemetery in Gorton before being stabbed.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN: The big party's been postponed so let the Mail bring VE Day to YOU!
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Of all the last-minute cancellations caused by the ghastly coronavirus, one of the saddest is the great national gathering which we should all have been enjoying.

item.title: Tiger King's Joe Exotic 'killed more than 100 tigers'
item.description: Erik Cowie, the head zookeeper at the GW Exotic Animal Park in Oklahoma, exclusively claimed to DailyMailTV that Joe Exotic killed more than 100 tigers.

item.title: Five of Meghan Markle's best friends could be called to give evidence
item.description: Mr Markle says he shared the letter with The Mail on Sunday only after Meghan's friends gave an interview about it to the US magazine People.

item.title: Dominic Cummings is a member of secretive SAGE group advising the government
item.description: Mr Cummings' name was on a leaked list of members of the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (SAGE) as far back as February.

item.title: Italy's coronavirus outbreak began in January, study shows
item.description: Italy was the first western country where the number of Covid-19 cases dramatically shot up, leading to 12,000 deaths by the end of March. A study shows Covid-19 was in Italy from January.

item.title: Meet the women who have their own 'shedquarters' to work from during the coronavirus lockdown
item.description: For some lucky workers, their existing garden rooms are proving to be a lifeline. Here, Sadie Nicholas meets four women thanking their lucky lockdown stars for their 'shedquarters'...

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Prince Andrew's treasured golf tournament for young people is axed
item.description: RICHARD EDEN: I can disclose that the golf tournament Andrew took such pride in organising for young people has been axed after 20 years.

item.title: Hospital secretary sacked for repeatedly checking her own medical records wins £270,000 payout
item.description: Sarah Austin, 53, was fired by Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust, where she'd worked for 25 years, after using her hospital computer to access her and her mother's files 140 times.

item.title: WH cleans up transcript of Dr. Birx appearing to endorse idea of treating COVID-19 with UV rays
item.description: The White House put out a corrected transcript of the daily briefing with just one revision to a comment that initially made it seem Dr. Birx was touting heat and light as a treatment for coronavirus.

item.title: New push to test millions sees 5,000 home kits run out by 6am and drive-through slots by 10am
item.description: A new website where key workers can book coronavirus tests buckled under an unprecedented demand from those with symptoms yesterday. It sparked an apology from the Department of Health.

item.title: Where did Britain's cocaine king stash his cash?
item.description: In less troubled times, Wright's early release would have caused quite a stir, for he flooded Britain with drugs that caused untold misery and destroyed countless lives.

item.title: Hospitals treat one new stab victim every 90 minutes
item.description: Figures published by the NHS revealed treatment after blade attacks increased to a record high - typically one patient every 90 minutes. Dozens of those would have tragically lost their lives.

item.title: Officers raid £2million cannabis farm... which criminals had set up just 800ft from a police station
item.description: Nearly 3,000 plants were seized from a gang at a site in Southend-on-Sea, Essex as Emiljan Gjura, 31, and Ermir Reshiti, 35, were charged with producing illegal drugs

item.title: SUE REID: Cancer victims forgotten, vital operations cancelled and ghost town A&Es
item.description: SUE REID: The photographs show the deserted casualty departments at two of our biggest hospitals. They were taken in the daytime amid the coronavirus lockdown.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow's £3,000 advice for a perfect 'date night' during lockdown
item.description: She had been roundly mocked for some of her bizarre suggestions on how women can spice up their love life. But Gwyneth Paltrow clearly believes ridicule is nothing to be scared of.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Keeping grandparents away from their loved ones is cruel
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Only the most foolhardy would announce publicly that they are contemplating defying an instruction designed to protect them.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: McDonald's 'to reopen in May' as traffic grows
item.description: McDonald's could open its UK stores by mid-May, reports suggest. It comes as figures from the AA shows more car journeys were made over the past few weeks. Pictured: the A40 in west London.

item.title: NHS staff get free drive-through food at London's five-star Berkeley Hotel
item.description: The luxury 5-star Berkeley Hotel in London's Knightsbridge has been closed for over a month due to the lockdown, but the kitchen staff are still preparing 250 free meals a day for key workers.

item.title: Missing estate agent Chelsie Dack wrote Facebook post before she took her own life
item.description: Chelsie Dack (pictured), from Gorleston-on-Sea, Norfolk, spoke about life in insolation and said life was getting 'scarier by the day' and that she had 'really underestimated this current situation'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Isle of Wight hospital to get supplies by drone
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps today committed to fast-tracking the launch of trials between the Solent ports and St Mary's Hospital on the Isle of Wight to ensure the flow of equipment and medicines.

item.title: Scathing letters from Sex Pistols' manager Malcolm McLaren to Richard Branson uncovered
item.description: The British punk rock band were signed to Virgin Records at the time but McLaren accused Branson's (pictured in 1979) record label of 'pilfering and pirating' their famous studio album.

item.title: Donald Trump hate-watches CNN in the residence, is not in the Oval Office until noon
item.description: President Donald Trump has soured on his lockdown according to a report, and is making it through his day with frequent TV viewing and contentious press briefings that are a highlight.

item.title: Pensioner, 68, on a walk during lockdown dies of suspected heart attack
item.description: Pensioner Kenneth Hawker, 68, died after a 'serious altercation' with a stranger in the middle of a residential street in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, police revealed.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 19,499 with 684 new fatalities
item.description: It comes as more questions emerged over the true number of Britons dying in care homes today after figures from Northern Ireland showed a third of all fatalities were elderly residents.

item.title: Miracle grandad-of-14, 75, beats coronavirus despite only having ONE lung after battle in hospital
item.description: William Burns, 75, is a two-times cancer survivor who medics feared would be overcome by the ravages of the deadly disease when he was admitted to hospital with breathing problems.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence's baroness mother with leading BAME review
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer asked Baroness Doreen Lawrence, whose son Stephen was killed in a racist attack 27 years ago this week, to drill down into troubling trends emerging in the epidemic.

item.title: Coronavirus victim, 29, messaged his fiancé 'thank you for the best life'
item.description: Richard McKeag, known as Ricky, from Bacup in Lancashire had been working on-call care support shifts before he contracted Covid-19, his partner Katie Martin, 25, said.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: How many people in London have REALLY had it?
item.description: Early antibody surveys suggest that between 1.25% and 31% of various communities have been infected with COVID-19, and the World Health Organization estimates the global figure is 2-3%.

item.title: CMO Chris Whitty says membership of secretive Sage committee SHOULD be made public
item.description: Professor Whitty said neither he nor Sir Patrick Vallance objected 'in principle' to the members of the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies (Sage) being common knowledge.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scotland could soon allow small gatherings
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon today suggested people in Scotland could soon be allowed to meet a small 'bubble' of friends or family outside of their households under plans to ease the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Moment submarine commander John Lewis ignores orders NOT to stage dockside coronavirus lockdown BBQ
item.description: Commander John Lewis held an impromptu party for the crew from the 'hunter-killer' sub HMS Trenchant alongside their boat at Devonport naval base after being at sea for two months.

item.title: Forty guests attend extravagant wedding in coronavirus lockdown - and offer police a BEER
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Officers were told that just 10 guests would be present, and that all belonged to the same family living at the address. But footage from later shows a gathering of about 40.

item.title: Piers Morgan apologises to Ofcom after fans bombard watchdog over his 'grilling' of Helen Whately
item.description: The Good Morning Britain presenter had asked his fans to bombard TV watchdog Ofcom in support of his 'grilling' of MP Helen Whately over the coronavirus crisis last week.

item.title: Nine members of rapper's entourage are jailed over brawl that left S-Club 7 star's cousin dead
item.description: The men aged 20 to 29 were jailed for between 20 and 26 months at Reading Crown Court today after the fight in Maidstone, Kent, which ended in the death of Andre Bent (pictured).

item.title: Iceland's whaling companies will not carry out ANY hunting this summer for a second straight year
item.description: Iceland's two whaling companies, IP-Utgerd and Hvalur, will skip the whale hunt this summer for the second straight year, in part due to coronavirus.
item.media:credit: The Asahi Shimbun via Getty Imag

item.title: Kondyor Massif crater in Siberia contains so many precious metals it's known as treasure mountain
item.description: A crater caused by a crashed meteor or the remnants of a colossal dormant volcano? Neither. Kondyor Massif in Siberia's far east is the result of a little-understood surge of volcanic rock.

item.title: Stunning mansion boasting its own cinema, bowling alley, two swimming pools and spa goes on sale
item.description: The property, owned by English businessman Gerard Ayrton-Grime, is called Sydenhurst and is based in Chiddingfold, Surrey. The home has nine bedrooms and spans nearly 27,000sq. ft.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall admits she 'really misses' her grandchildren
item.description: The Duchess of Cornwall's comments came in a call from her Birkhall home to an elderly user of the Silver Line, a 24-hour helpline for older people feeling lonely or in need of support,

item.title: Ben Goldsmith welcomes a baby girl and names her Vita Iris in tribute to his daughter Iris
item.description: Ben and Jemima named their daughter Vita Iris in honour of Ben's daughter Iris, who lost her life in a buggy accident at the family home in Somerset last summer.

item.title: Matt Hancock sounds like a quartermaster, says ex-head of Army medics Dr Michael von Bertele
item.description: It is vital that the government reviews its strategy and focuses on the end state, not the current battle, writes DR MICHAEL VON BERTELE, former Director General of Army Medical Services.

item.title: Met Police arrest 100 people a day for domestic violence in lockdown
item.description: Metropolitan Police Commander Sue Williams said charges and cautions were up 24 per cent from March 9, when people with Covid-19 symptoms were asked to self-isolate, compared to last year.

item.title: Moment teenage driver tries to outrun police in a Nissan Micra with his pregnant girlfriend in car
item.description: Jordan Archer (pictured), 18, Blyth, Northumberland, pleaded guilty to two counts of dangerous driving, having no insurance and driving otherwise in accordance with a licence.

item.title: NASA engineers design a mass-producible ventilator tailored to coronavirus patients
item.description: The 'Ventilator Intervention Technology Accessible Locally' (VITAL) device passed a critical test at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai in New York on April 21.

item.title: You had one job! South Africa's President Ramaphosa hilariously struggles to put coronavirus mask on
item.description: South Africa President Cyril Ramaphosa was captured struggling to get his facemask on after delivering a speech on the importance of wearing them, in a blunder livestreamed yesterday.

item.title: Pregnant clinical fellow and doctor husband sue Government over failure to give NHS staff PPE
item.description: Dr Meenal Viz, a clinical fellow in medicine, and Luton GP trainee Dr Nishant Joshi, are suing the Government over the lawfulness of current guidance and failure to source PPE for NHS staff.

item.title: Blockbuster movie Joker may have made film-goers more prejudiced
item.description: A study by researchers at the University of Otago in New Zealand found that animosity towards people with troubled minds increased when people watched the movie.

item.title: Border Force intercepts five boats carrying about 60 migrants off Kent coast
item.description: At least three children - including two young girls - were seen being brought ashore as migrants continued to cross the Channel to Britain's south coast.

item.title: Heartwarming viral video captures emotional reunion between dog best friends
item.description: The clip was shared on TikTok by user Stefani Maryn, from Hamilton, Ontario, and in the six days since it was posted, the video has racked up more than 3.6 million views.

item.title: Gangs of London leaves viewers gripped but insist violence is not for the faint hearted
item.description: New Sky Atlantic drama Gangs of London left viewers gripped with it's 'increible' fight scenes, but insisted the 'brutal' violence of the show left them wincing at the graphic scenes

item.title: Almost half of people have seen a rise in speeding during lockdown
item.description: Roads with 30mph limits that have been found to be most lethal, with Department for Transport data showing that 60% of all accidents and 34% of all traffic-related fatalities occur in these zones.

item.title: Hubble Space Telescope releases a 'breathtaking' new image of a giant nebula
item.description: Named the 'tapestry of blazing starbirth', the new image brings together the nebula NGC 2014 and its neighbour NGC 2020 - both about 163,000 light years from Earth

item.title: Australia is steamrolling the curve: Nation records just 17 cases in one day
item.description: Just 17 new cases of COVID-19, the killer respiratory virus which was crippled dozens of other countries, were recorded in Australia in the 24 hours from midnight on Thursday.

item.title: Hermes couriers caught sending packages straight to auction houses 'three to four times a week'
item.description: In tonight's episode of the Channel 4 show Joe Lycett's Got Your Back, the team discover delivery service Hermes are sending packages straight to auction houses in Birmingham.

item.title: First coronavirus vaccine could be ready by September, head of China's CDC claims
item.description: Dr Gao Fu, director-general of China's Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, said that China expects to have a successful vaccine candidate for the deadly disease by September.

item.title: Sweden sees record number of coronavirus infections for second day in a row - 812
item.description: Sweden has reported a record number of new coronavirus cases for the second day in a row - 812 - just as the country threatens to close bars and restaurants that don't social distance.

item.title: Almost FOUR MILLION workers are now having their wages paid by the Government
item.description: Some 512,000 firms employing 3.8million people have applied to furlough them on the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme since Monday. Brewer Greene King furloughed 36,000 today.

item.title: Most students whose exams have been cancelled due to coronavirus will be graded on previous work
item.description: Under plans announced by Ofqual on Friday, many students will receive a calculated result based on what staff in schools and colleges think they would have achieved in their assessments this summer.

item.title: Kent zoo keeper may have to euthanise his animals so they don't starve as funds run out in lockdown
item.description: The owner of the Fenn Bell Conservation Project in St Mary Hoo, Kent, Andy Cowell, 51, is struggling to find enough money to pay his £2,000-a-day animal food bill during the lockdown.

item.title: Scientists reveal ferocious predators roamed Africa's SAHARA 100 million years ago
item.description: A team of international researchers found that what is today the Sahara region was home to 'ferocious predators' around 100 million years ago.
item.media:description: An artist´s impression of the Sahara 100 million years ago (University of Portsmouth/PA)

item.title: Tropical coral reefs are being transformed by climate change
item.description: Climate change and warming seas are severely bleaching tropical coral reefs and undoing decades of knowledge about how to protect these delicate and vital ecosystems.

item.title: Coronavirus: Government under fire over test and trace programme staffing levels
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock announced yesterday that some 18,000 staff will be put in place as part of the mass-testing scheme but scientists do not believe that will be enough.

item.title: Wi-Fi to get its biggest upgrade in 20 years after FCC's 6GHz decision
item.description: The US Federal Communications Commission has approved is opening up spectrum in the 6GHz band, ushering an era of fast, low latency internet connections.

item.title: Sicily will PAY half the price of tourists' flights in bid to lure back holidaymakers after lockdown
item.description: A €50 million budget will pay for the scheme designed to rejuvenate tourism. The vouchers will be made available on the island's tourism website.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Trump's coronavirus 'cure' theories will kill
item.description: President Trump stooped to a shameful new low by suggesting people suffering from COVID-19 be injected with toxic disinfectant. It's hard to imagine a more stupid thing for a President to say

item.title: Germany starts preparing for SECOND wave of coronavirus
item.description: Germany's infection rate has slowed to a record low this week, with only a 1.6 per cent growth in cases for each of the last three days (new cases are shown on a graph, with 2,337 added today).

item.title: British tourists have to prove they are covid-19 free and have movements tracked in Canary Islands
item.description: Foreign holidaymakers would be expected to download the movement tracking app on to thier devices before being allowed to step foot in the Canary Islands, claims tourism chiefs.

item.title: Prince Charles praises the 'vital role' of the British Asian community
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, has praised the British Asian community for it's contribution to the national coronavirus pandemic as he launched a fundraising appeal for families struggling in South Asia.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle send sympathy message to family of girl, 18, who died during lockdown
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sent a personal message of condolence to a Liverpool family whose terminally-ill daughter died. Holly Smallman, 18, met Harry when he gave her sister Ruby an award.

item.title: China names first Mars exploration mission Tianwen-1 after an ancient poem
item.description: Tianwen-1 is a robotic exploration mission to the Red Planet and is due to launch in the summer of this year - around the same time as the NASA Perseverance rover.

item.title: The stunning winning images in the All About Photo Awards 2020 photography competition
item.description: The All About Photo Awards - The Mind's Eye has announced 40 winning images for 2020. Monica Denevan from the U.S was named Photographer of the Year for an image shot in Myanmar.

item.title: Stylish dog owner dresses her three-year-old whippet
item.description: Paz Castro, 38, a jewellery designer, from Hackney, London, aspired for her three-year-old whippet Lloyd to mirror her monochrome style of grey turtle necks and neutral fabrics.

item.title: Builder sues church for 'religious discrimination' after he was kicked out of priest's home
item.description: Builder Jonathan Bennetts and his family moved into the St Just Free Church manse in Penzance, Cornwall on reduced rent for voluntary caretaking but was kicked out after a new minister was appointed.

item.title: British 'ISIS rapper' was caught in Spain after he was identified by his EARS as he hid behind mask
item.description: British 'ISIS rapper' Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary was identified by his ears after sneaking into Spain by boat, it emerged today. Bary, 29, took advantage of coronavirus lockdown to hide behind a face mask.

item.title: Music industry opposes UK Music's appointment of Tom Watson as chairman
item.description: Tom Watson is a controversial figure for many reasons chief amoung them being his support for an investigation into an alleged Westminster VIP peadophile ring in 2012.

item.title: Chessington testing centre 'loses NHS staff results or sends them to wrong people'
item.description: The facility at the Surrey theme park, run by accountancy firm Deloitte, also was not able to contact workers with their diagnosis because they recorded incorrect phone numbers, it is claimed.

item.title: Woman who has been indulging in a bottle of wine each night since lockdown begun
item.description: A woman who has been drinking a bottle of wine daily since the UK lockdown sparked a debate about alcohol consumption on Mumsnet, where some warned that she's overdoing it.

item.title: Japanese mayor says only men should be allowed to go grocery shopping
item.description: 'When a woman goes... it will take time,' Mayor of Osaka Matsui Ichiro said when asked about possibly reducing shoppers' entry to supermarkets to lower the risk of coronavirus spread.

item.title: How Marcus Rashford's childhood has driven £20m crusade to feed Manchester kids during Covid crisis
item.description: CHRIS WHEELER: The coronavirus crisis stirred something very close to home for Marcus Rashford. He thought of vulnerable children, much like himself at school, who may go hungry or suffer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Janet Street-Porter says bureaucrats impede NHS
item.description: In the UK, everyone knows or knows of someone who has died from Covid-19 and our lives have dramatically changed for the foreseeable future, writes JANET STREET-PORTER.

item.title: Social distan-sing! Plans are unveiled for world's first drive-in opera at Alexandra Palace
item.description: Performers will adhere to social-distancing rules during the performance of Puccini's La Bohème and Mozart's The Magic Flute, which will take place over three weeks in September in Haringey, north London.

item.title: Expert shares advice for cleaning areas of the home that are often forgotten
item.description: Cleaning experts from British electrical retailer AO.com have revealed their top cleaning tips to FEMAIL, including disinfecting your shoe rack, because COVID-19 can survive on soles.

item.title: Luxury shoppers are buying rare handbags and trainers more than ever
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, David Bennett, Worldwide Chairman of Sotheby's Jewellery Division, said luxury goods are having their best performance ever, because they're safer than gold or stock.

item.title: Apple says there is 'no evidence' flaw in Mail app for iPhones and iPads used to attack customers
item.description: San Francisco-based security firm ZecOps revealed a flaw on April 22 that it said may have left more than half a billion iPhones vulnerable to hackers.

item.title: Man quoted £900 to renovate kitchen does it himself for just £91
item.description: Calum Butler, 23, from Aberaeron, Wales, gave his 'dark and outdated' kitchen a modern makeover for just £91 - after being quoted £900 by a professional.

item.title: Nando's release a step by step guide to their famous recipes
item.description: As many Brits are craving their favourite takeaways during the lockdown, restaurant chain Nando's have released a step by step guide to their famous dishes during a cook-along live on Instagram.

item.title: Harry Dunn death: RAF base probes crash as SECOND American accused of driving on wrong side
item.description: The Harry Dunn family have called for RAF Croughton to launch a probe after claiming images of a crash involving a staff member in Aynho, Northamptonshire, emerged last night.

item.title: Top Iranian commander orders naval forces to target any 'terrorist' US warships
item.description: Iranian Revolutionary Guards commander Major General Hossein Salami made the announcement about the naval directive while speaking with state press.

item.title: Sleep expert reveals EXACTLY what happens to your body when you oversleep
item.description: A sleep expert revealed exactly what happens to your body when you over-sleep or sleep for longer than ten hours - and it's bad news for your concentration, mood, performance and waistline.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Forget fake news... fake cheese is the real problem to chew over
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: To listen to Donald Trump and his querimonious outbursts, you'd think 'fake news' never existed before he arrived in the White House.

item.title: Home cook reveals a simple trick that will stop food going to waste
item.description: Creative home cooks are making 'pizza omelettes' with the old vegetables in their fridge to prevent food wastage - with surprisingly tasty results.

item.title: BAZ BAMIGBOYE: Take That are to relight their fire... with big screen version of their stage musical
item.description: BAZ BAMIGBOYE: The big screen version of Take That musical The Band is being actively developed during the lockdown, with 'high calibre' film stars being sought to appear in it.

item.title: PATRICK MARMION: Brush up on the Birthday Bard... then you can impress thy friends on Zoom!
item.description: PATRICK MARMION: Forsooth, gentle reader, is this, or is this not the week of Shakespeare's birth? Let us undertake a little 'True Or False' quiz on England's national poet...

item.title: TikTok users are sharing their glow-DOWNS, before-and-after pictures showing they 'peaked' long ago
item.description: Gabrielle McDonald wanted to see the opposite of glow-ups. She said: 'The hottest I've ever been was when I was 18. I look nothing like that now.'

item.title: Africa's 43% jump in virus cases in one week as WHO warn continent could become the next epicentre
item.description: African governments reported a total of nearly 26,000 cases as of today, according to the Africa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. That figure is up from just over 16,000 a week ago.

item.title: Why therapy is no match for the true madness of GRIEF
item.description: UK-based author Juliet Rosenfeld has penned a memoir detailing the loss of her partner and loss of faith in the power of psychoanalysis to make soothing sense of trauma.

item.title: Lockdown punch-up! Stunt school students trade blows in an ingenious coronavirus challenge video
item.description: Students from the stunt double school Campus Univers Cascades in northern France made a clever video of students punching or kicking each other in an elaborate chain of staged violence.
